text:
Julie Anne Payne (July 10, 1940 – June 7, 2019) was an American actress. She appeared in television and movies between 1959 and 1967. Payne's credits include movies "Honeymoon Hotel" (1964), "Island of the Blue Dolphins" (1964) and "Don't Make Waves" (1967), and series such as "The Big Valley" and "The Wild Wild West".
Payne was born in Los Angeles, California. She married screenwriter Robert Towne in 1977, and later divorced. The couple had a daughter. Payne died of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease on June 7, 2019. She was 78.
